response:
The prescribed dose of lasix was too low. The patient was admitted for a heart failure exacerbation and required an increase in her lasix dosing frmo 20mg to 40mg daily. With a lasix dose of <40mg daily, the patient will return with heart failure.
The patient has a history of coronary artery disease, without her aspirin prescription, she develops chest pain and returns to the emergency department.
The patient has a history of atrial fibrillation and was given too small of a dose of metoprolol. She returns to the emergency department with atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular response. 
The patient was prescribed too small of a dose of insulin and developed symptomatic hypoglycemia. She returns to the emergency department.
The patient was prescribed too small of a dose of lipitor. She returned to the emergency department with a stroke.
